    Knit engines

    knit-engines.Rmd

    This article introduces additional knit engines.

    Load atusydown package primarily to enable features described here.

    library(atusydown)

    glue

    The glue engine is useful in programatically writing texts. As documented in ?glue::glue,

    Expressions enclosed by braces will be evaluated as R code. Long strings are broken by line and concatenated together. Leading whitespace and blank lines from the first and last lines are automatically trimmed.

    For example, let’s substitute {name} by “Atusy”.

    First use r engine like below.

    name <- "Atusy"

    And then use glue engine like below. Note that source chunk never echoes.

    ```{glue}
> **My name is {name}.**
This output is powered by glue package!
```

    My name is Atusy. This output is powered by glue package!

    Nice text! The output text is rendered as Pandoc’s markdown.

    Extra arguments of glue::glue() can be controlled by specifying glue.args. A following example replaces a expression enclosed by percents (% and %) instead of default braces ({ and })

    ```{glue, glue.args = list(.open = "%", .close = "%")}
> **My name is %name%.**
This output is powered by glue package!
```

    My name is Atusy. This output is powered by glue package!

    footnote and fn

    A footnote engine and its alias fn generates footnote whose label is inherited from chunk label1. The footnote engine is powered by glue::glue(), so that options are same as those of the glue engine.

    ```{fn fn-footnote}
knitr:::knit_code$get("fn-note")
```

    opts

    The opts engine returns chunk options of a current chunk.

    By default, all the available options are returned. The output of opts can be limited by specifying either "diff" or "src" to a chunk option called opts.show.

    The output of opts is by default sorted by names. The sorting can be disabled by specifying opts.sort = FALSE.

    Note that source chunk never echoes.

    Show all the chunk options (default)

    ```{opts}
The content of chunk is ignored.
```
    #> List of 58
#>  $ aniopts      : chr "controls,loop"
#>  $ autodep      : logi FALSE
#>  $ background   : chr "#F7F7F7"

    Show options different from opts_chunk$get() by opts.show = "diff"

    Specifying ops.show = "diff" as a chunk option returns chunk options of the source chunk which have different values from knitr::opts_chunk$get().

    ```{opts opts-diff, foo = "bar", opts.show = "diff"}

```
    #> List of 11
#>  $ cache        : num 0
#>  $ code         : chr ""
#>  $ dpi          : int 192
#>  $ engine       : chr "opts"
#>  $ foo          : chr "bar"
#>  $ label        : chr "opts-diff"
#>  $ opts.show    : chr "diff"
#>  $ out.height.px: num 433
#>  $ out.width    : num 700
#>  $ out.width.px : num 700
#>  $ params.src   : chr "opts-diff, foo = \"bar\", opts.show = \"diff\", engine=\"opts\""

    Show input options in the chunk by opts.show = "src"

    Specifying opts.show = "src" as a chunk option returns chunk options that are set in the source chunk.

    ```{opts opts-src, opts.show = "src"}

```
    #> List of 2
#>  $ engine   : chr "opts"
#>  $ opts.show: chr "src"

    1. This is a footnote generated by fn engine.↩
